zone.line: except that which led me ever to dwell
on your then infantine image.
"It is a strange link in my
fate that without having seen you
I should passionately love you. During
my wanderings I never slept without
first calling down gentle dreams on
your head. If I saw a lovely woman, I
thought, does my Mathilda resemble her?
All delightful things, sublime scenery,
soft breezes, exquisite music seemed
to me associated with you and only
through you to be pleasant to me.
At length I saw you. You appeared
as the deity of a lovely region, the
ministering Angel of a Paradise to
which of all human kind you ad
mitted only me. I dared hardly consider
you as my daughter; your beauty,
artlessness and untaught wisdom seemed
to belong to a higher order of beings; your
voice breathed forth only words of love:
if there was aught of earthly in you
